verse.roman:
āha tv ātmānubhāvena
pūrṇa-kāmasya te vibho
karavāma kim īśāna
yenedaṁ nirvṛtaṁ jagat

synonyms: āha—Mārkaṇḍeya said; tu—indeed; ātma-anubhāvena—by your own experience of ecstasy; pūrṇa-kāmasya—who is satisfied in all respects; te—for you; vibho—O mighty one; karavāma—I can do; kim—what; īśāna—O lord; yena—by whom; idam—this; nirvṛtam—is made peaceful; jagat—the entire world.
translation: Mārkaṇḍeya said: O mighty lord, what can I possibly do for you, who are fully satisfied by your own ecstasy? Indeed, by your mercy you satisfy this entire world.
